post.description: Ggenerate an embossing file based on the card SKU which contains details like cardholder's name, CVV, expiration date, and so on. This endpoint only applies to those orders that just have a single card ID to process in that specific order.</br> To obtain the card ID, use `orders/{orderID}/cards/list` endpoint. Fetch all the cards in the order and note the `cardID` of the card for which the embossing file is to be generated.

parameters.name: cardID
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the card for which the embossing file is to be generated.

500.description: Error occurred. Please try again after some time.

get.summary: Get card order details by Order ID
get.description: Get details like quantity, card SKU, and expiry for a specific order.

parameters.name: orderID
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the card order for which details are being fetched.

patch.summary: Deactivate/Activate/Delete card by Form Factor ID
patch.description: Use the endpoint to activate, deactivate, or delete a card by changing its status. Please note that if you are deleting the card, specifying the reason(request body parameter) is required.</br></br>To get the Resource ID and Form Factor ID for the endpoint, call the `/orders/{orderID}/cards/list` endpoint. The response returns an array of all the cards in the order with each card's ID and Resource ID. `cardID` provides the value for Form Factor ID, and note the Resource ID from `uri:resource://{resourceID}` parameter.

parameters.name: resourceID
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Resource with which the Card is associated with.

requestBody.description:
Specify the following parameters in the request body to change the status of the card. Please note that if you are deleting the card, specifying the reason (code, description) is required.
  • `status`: Required. Status of the card.
    Supported values â€” `ACTIVE` to activate the card; `INACTIVE` to deactivate the card; `DELETED` to delete the card.
  • `code`: Code of the reason for changing the status of the card. Optional for activating/deactivating the card. Required for deleting the card.
    Supported values: `LOST_OR_STOLEN`, `DAMAGED`, `HOTLISTED`, `OFAC_BLOCKED`, `OTHER`
  • `description`: Human-readable description of the reason for changing the status of the card. Length must be less than 200 characters. Optional for activating/deactivating the card. Required for deleting the card.

reason.description: temporarily deactivated due to suspicious activity
Card is damaged and needs to be replaced

500.description: Unexpected Error occoured.Please try agian after some time.

post.description: The PAYMENT_REQUESTED event triggers when a payment request is received by the payment engine. The engine determines the Account Holder, Wallet or Accounts to be used in the payment.
THE PAYMENT_AUTHORIZATION_REQUESTED triggers when a transaction plan is created for the payment and the plan is sent as a request to the payment authorizer to authorize the request.
The PAYMENT_AUTHORIZATION_RECEIVED event triggers when the transaction plan for the payement is successfully authorized by the payment authorizer.
The PAYMENT_EFFECTED event triggers when the host has successfully posted the entries as per the transaction plan.
The PAYMENT_CAPTURED event triggers when the response to the payment request is acknowledged by the requesting entity.
The PAYMENT_REVERSED event triggers when the reversal payment request is CAPTURED.
The PAYMENT_REQUEST_DECLINED event triggers when the engine declines the payment and returns a failure response for an invalid payment request.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Select the name of the event that you want to subscribe to and receive the event payload.

post.description: This API registers a webhook to receive transactional events in the payment flow. Additionally, refer to the Callbacks tab to get a list of all events triggered during a payment.

reason.description: Reason for changing the status of the card. Optional for activating/deactivating the card. Required for deleting the card.

code.description: Code of the reason for cancelling the card. Optional for activating/deactivating the card. Required for deleting the card.

description.description: Human-readable description of the reason for changing the status of the card. Length must be less than 200 characters. Optional for activating/deactivating the card. Required for deleting the card.

orderID.description: Unique identifier of the card order for which details are being retrieved.

cardSkuID.description: Unique identifier for card's configurational properties like card network, BIN, card-type, embossing vendor details.

plasticCode.description: Unique identifier for the program configured for card. In case of multiple benefit programs, each program is represented by a separate `plasticCode`.

thirdLineEmbossing.description: Cardholder's name displayed on the card.

fourthLineEmbossing.description: Additional cardholder details, like company name, displayed on the card.

deliveryAddress.description: Address where the card is delivered to.

vendorAttributes.description: Vendor related information like shipping partner, tracking ID, and welcome kit.

orderedAt.description: Timestamp of order placment in the ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SS:sss'Z'
